fields.name: user
fields.doc: Information about the user who made the interaction.

fields.name: channel
fields.doc: The channel where the interaction occured.

fields.name: token
fields.doc: A verification token to validate that the event originated from Slack (deprecated).

fields.name: callback_id
fields.doc: This value is the unique callback_id identifier your app gave this instance of the dialog. Use the callback_id to keep track of which form submission is which, not to store state.

fields.name: state
fields.doc: This string simply echoes back what your app passed to dialog.open. Use it as a pointer that references sensitive data stored elsewhere. The state string may be up to 3,000 characters long.

fields.name: action_ts
fields.doc: This is a unique identifier for this specific action occurrence generated by Slack. It can be evaluated as a timestamp with milliseconds if that is helpful to you.

fields.name: response_url
fields.doc: The URL can be used to post responses to dialog submissions.
